#Text=Indiana Governor signs needle exchange program
#Text=Friday , May 8 , 2015
#Text=Pence was a former US Representative and elected Indiana 's Governor in 2012 .
#Text=He will face reelection next year .
#Text=Image : United States Congress .

#Text=Indiana Governor Mike Pence dropped his former opposition to needle exchange programs and on Tuesday signed legislation passed by lawmakers on April 29 — the last day of the state 's legislative session — that would allow local health departments , municipalities , counties , or nonprofit organizations to implement needle exchange programs .
#Text=The debate about the controversial programs came on the heels of an HIV outbreak in Southern Indiana .
#Text=Austin , in Scott County , Indiana , was the epicenter of the outbreak .
#Text=The number of new HIV positive cases in Scott County in this outbreak rose past 140 .
#Text=Governor Pence declared the outbreak a public health emergency on March 26 , and at the same time approved a 30-day needle exchange program .
#Text=Pence since offered a 30-day extension as the number of HIV positive cases continued to rise .
#Text=Needle exchange programs provide clean needles in exchange for dirty needles .
#Text=The sharing of dirty needles has been linked to the outbreak .
#Text=Experts like Chris Beyrer , president of the International AIDS Society , support needle exchange programs .
#Text=Beyrer told the Indianapolis Star , however , that temporary measures , like the one Pence implemented on March 26 , do n't solve the long-term problem .
#Text=The World Health Organization and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention also recommend needle exchange programs .
#Text=But experts say long-term needle exchange programs are needed .
#Text=The HIV epidemic in Southern Indiana has been linked to a drug problem in Scott County .
#Text=HIV and Hepatitis C are blood-borne viruses that spread by way of bodily fluids and bloodstream injections , especially when more than one person is using the same needle .
#Text=Legislators on the committee responsible for Senate Bill 461 heard testimony last week before voting .
#Text=Representative Thomas Washburne , Republican , Evansville , told Wikinews on April 27 that he was involved in conversations pertaining to needle exchange programs .
#Text=" I am inclined to follow the recommendations of the Centers for Disease Control in implementing needle exchanges , " Washburne said in an interview with Wikinews .
#Text=" My vote against Senate Bill 461 was not due to the needle exchanges , but other issues involved in the bill . "
#Text=House members passed the bill 80 – 19 , senators 38 – 11 .
#Text=After legislators passed the bill , Pence told WISH-TV : " From my perspective , the focus needs to be on health emergencies .

#Text=He said the best course of action would be to  block and tackle . "

column1: #Text=" Needle exchange programs ought to be used , " Shaffner said .
#Text=" They have been proven to work and do not cause an increase in drug use . "
#Text=Dr. William Schaffner presents March 25 , 2015 at the 2015 Shaw Lecture at the University of Southern Indiana about emerging infectious diseases .
#Text=Image : Gkstylianides .
#Text=USI Biology
#Text=Professor Marlene Shaw welcomes a full house to the 2015 Shaw Lecture on March 25 , 2015 at the University of Southern Indiana .
#Text=Image : Gkstylianides .

#Text=A crowd of students , faculty and healthcare professionals gather during the 2015 Shaw Lecture on March 25 , 2015 in Mitchell Auditorium at the University of Southern Indiana to hear Dr. William Shaffner present .
#Text=Image : Gkstylianides .
#Text=Dr. William Shaffner answers questions from students on March 25 , 2015 during the 2015 Shaw Lecture at the University of Southern Indiana .
#Text=Image : Gkstylianides .
